label: 菩提所
本: Jewel in the Ashes: Buddha Relics and Power in Early Medieval Japan . Harvard University Asia Center . 2000
説明文: Bodaisho (菩提所), also referred to as bodaiji (菩提寺), kōge'in (香華院).  An outgrowth of the gradual splintering of great clans such as the Fujiwaras who sponsored the construction of clan-temples (氏寺 ujidera) from the 7th century on, the bodaisho or bodhi sites" were temples constructed on behalf of lineages from the Heian era on, and which primarily offered memorial   services in an effort to transfer merit (回向 ekō) to deceased ancestors, though sometimes to produce future merit during the life of the rite's sponsor (i.e., so-called 逆修 gyakushu)."
